lines.content: for testing in week 2, used chatgpt find why test fails despite expected and actual look the same. and used it togenerate these command sed -i '' 's/[[:space:]]*$//' ACTUAL.TXT
for week2 level 5, used chatgpt for debugging
and used it to regnerate the runtest.sh to make sure
it can be used to test error handling. I also used
it to generate some test scripts for error handling
for level 5, gpt suggest me to use trim method to remove the redundant whitespace that can cause unexpected behaviour in error handling
used chatgpt to format the code cleanly
// Pick ONE compatible with your Gradle:
Welcome to **Manbo** üéâ ‚Äì your personal chatbot assistant.
Manbo helps you organize tasks, set deadlines, and manage your to-do list in a simple and intuitive way.
This guide explains all the important features and how you can use them.
Manbo allows you to add tasks with specific due dates.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Use this when you want to add a task without a deadline.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Once you finish a task, you can mark it as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
List all current tasks to see what‚Äôs pending and what‚Äôs completed.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Remove tasks you no longer need.
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Type the command below to quit the chatbot.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Start using **Manbo** today and make your task management simple and fun! üöÄ
* Main class for the Manbo task management application.
* Manbo is a personal task tracker that helps users manage their todos, deadlines, and events.
* The application supports adding, listing, marking, unmarking, and deleting tasks.
private final Storage storage = new Storage("data/manbo.txt");
private final List<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
private final Ui ui = new Ui();
* Main entry point for the Manbo application.
* Creates a new instance of Manbo and starts the application.
* Initializes the application, loads existing tasks from storage,
* and processes user commands until an exit command is received.
* Handles exceptions and displays appropriate error messages to the user.

// If your commands already save, you can omit the next line.
return new Reply(ui.out(), c.isExit());  // ui.out() is what your tests used

* Represents an abstract command in the Manbo application.
* must extend this class and implement the {@link #execute(List, Ui, Storage)} method.
* Commands encapsulate user actions and define how to manipulate the task list,
* interact with storage, and produce UI feedback.
* @param ui      the UI used for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes
* @throws ManboException if the command fails (invalid input, storage error, etc.)
public abstract void execute(List<Task> tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ManboException;

* Exception thrown when an invalid or malformed index is provided for task operations.

* Base exception class for all Manbo application-specific exceptions.

* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for interpreting raw user input
* strings and converting them into appropriate {@link Command} objects.

*

This is the first step of command execution in Manbo:

*
  • User input (e.g., "deadline return book /by 2025-09-01") is passed to {@link #parse(String)}.
*   <li>{@code Parser} identifies the command keyword and delegates to a
* dedicated handler for validation and argument parsing.
*   <li>The corresponding {@code Command} object is returned to the caller
* (typically the main program loop), ready for execution.
*   <li>Strong SLAP (Single Level of Abstraction Principle): {@link #parse(String)} only dispatches,
* detailed parsing happens in per-command handlers.

*
  • Guard clauses are used for clarity instead of deep nesting.

*
  • Magic strings (regex patterns) are centralized as constants.

*
  • Exceptions are thrown for invalid input to keep parsing robust.
private static final String SPLIT_ON_SPACES_ONCE = "\\s+"; // split keyword + args
private static final String HHMM_ONLY = "\\d{4}"; // e.g., "1830" = 6:30 PM
private Parser() { } // Parser is utility class, not instantiable
